apiKey.title: API Key Management
apiKey.description: Create and manage API keys for accessing OpenAPI
apiKey.name: Key Name
apiKey.deleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete API key {name}? This action cannot be undone.

docs.note1: Replace YOUR_API_KEY with your actual API Key
docs.note2: /api/config endpoint provides system configuration including available email domains
docs.note3: emailId is the unique identifier for an email
docs.note4: messageId is the unique identifier for a message
docs.note5: expiryTime is the validity period in milliseconds: 3600000 (1 hour), 86400000 (1 day), 604800000 (7 days), 0 (permanent)
docs.note6: domain is the email domain, get available domains from /api/config endpoint
docs.note7: cursor is for pagination, get nextCursor from previous response
docs.note9: expiresIn is the share link validity period in milliseconds, 0 means permanent
docs.note10: shareId is the unique identifier for a share record

emailService.title: Resend Email Service Configuration
emailService.emperorLimit: Emperor can send unlimited emails without any restrictions
emailService.enableDescription: When enabled, emails will be sent using Resend
emailService.roleLimits: Roles allowed to use sending feature

webhook.title: Webhook Configuration
webhook.description: Notify specified URL when new emails arrive
webhook.description2: We will send a POST request to this URL with information about the new email

docs.intro: When a new email is received, we will send a POST request to the configured URL with the following headers:
docs.subject: Email Subject

turnstile.enableDescription: When enabled, username/password login and registration require Turnstile verification
turnstile.secretKeyDescription: Set up a Turnstile application in Cloudflare and provide the required keys before enabling
